title: Two-handed
data:
A **two-handed** [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") is a type of weapon in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that requires both hands free in order to [wield](/wiki/Wield "Wield") it.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 List of two-handed weapons](#List_of_two-handed_weapons)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [5 See also](#See_also)

## Description

[You](/wiki/You "You") cannot wear a [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") or engage in [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat") while wielding a two-handed weapon. Hitting a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") with a two-handed weapon has a chance of performing a [shattering blow](/wiki/Shattering_blow "Shattering blow") that destroys its wielded weapon. [Monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") with weapon attacks, including [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), can wield two-handed weapons if they have the [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") attribute and are not wearing a shield.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

When you hit with a two-handed weapon other than a polearm, the damage bonus for Strength is increased by 50%.

## List of two-handed weapons

The weapons listed below are two-handed:

| Weapon                                                        | Skill            | Cost   | Weight | Prob (‰) | Dam. (S) | Dam. (L) | Material | Appearance         | Tile                                                                                          | Glyph |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------- | ------ | ------ | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | ------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----- |
| [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe")                   | axe              | 40 zm  | 120    | 10       | 7        | 8.5      | iron     | double-headed axe  | [![Battle-axe.png](/images/b/b2/Battle-axe.png)](/wiki/File:Battle-axe.png)                   | )     |
| [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock") | pick-axe         | 50 zm  | 120    | 13       | 6.5      | 11.5     | iron     | broad pick         | [![Dwarvish mattock.png](/images/a/ae/Dwarvish_mattock.png)](/wiki/File:Dwarvish_mattock.png) | )     |
| [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") | two-handed sword | 50 zm  | 150    | 22       | 6.5      | 10.5     | iron     |                    | [![Two-handed sword.png](/images/d/d2/Two-handed_sword.png)](/wiki/File:Two-handed_sword.png) | )     |
| [tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi")                            | two-handed sword | 500 zm | 60     | N/A      | 8.5      | 11.5     | metal    | long samurai sword | [![Tsurugi.png](/images/c/c1/Tsurugi.png)](/wiki/File:Tsurugi.png)                            | )     |
| [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")             | quarterstaff     | 5 zm   | 40     | 11       | 3.5      | 3.5      | wood     | staff              | [![Quarterstaff.png](/images/8/85/Quarterstaff.png)](/wiki/File:Quarterstaff.png)             | )     |
| [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")             | unicorn horn     | 100 zm | 20     | tool     | 6.5      | 6.5      | bone     |                    | [![Unicorn horn.png](/images/6/65/Unicorn_horn.png)](/wiki/File:Unicorn_horn.png)             | (     |

In addition to the weapons listed above, [polearms](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") are also two-handed, but are designed for [pounding](/wiki/Pound "Pound") and thus not as useful when handled as melee weapons.

## Strategy

Two-handed weapons are generally more damaging on average than one-handed weapons, but have a notoriously detrimental effect if you wield a cursed one, or else your currently-wielded weapon is cursed. While your hands are welded to a cursed two-hander, you cannot perform many actions including the following:

- [Looting](/wiki/Loot "Loot") or [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") containers
- Casting [spells](/wiki/Spell "Spell")
- [Removing](/wiki/Remove "Remove") [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") or [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring")

These handicaps also make it hard to get at your [curse removal](/wiki/Curse_removal "Curse removal") items, since you cannot cast spells and your uncursing items will usually be safely in your [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag"). Spellcasting monsters that cast [curse items](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items"), including the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), are often the most notorious culprits.

[Prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") to your [god](/wiki/God "God") can uncurse a cursed two-handed weapon: your god treats having both hands welded to cursed weapons and/or shields as a major. You can also use the #[tip](/wiki/Tip "Tip") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") to empty your bag on the floor and get at your curse removal tools - it is best to prepare a bag of such items in advance for when prayer is inconvenient or unavailable (e.g. in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom")). Some players also drop [holy water](/wiki/Potion_of_holy_water "Potion of holy water") on the ground in places that they easily [branchport](/wiki/Branchport "Branchport") or [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport") to.

## Variants

Variants based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions may lack the #tip command, which is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") - this makes wielding a cursed two-handed weapon a much more serious problem in those games, and players may choose to avoid these weapons entirely.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [bows](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), [crossbows](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), and some [firearms](/wiki/Firearm "Firearm") are two-handed. SLASH'EM also

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), two-handed weapons get double the damage bonus from strength.

## See also

- [Cleaver](/wiki/Cleaver "Cleaver")
- [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius")
- [The Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/The_Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "The Tsurugi of Muramasa")

A two-handed weapon is a type of weapon in NetHack that requires both hands free in order to wield it.

Contents

Description
